alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 18 at 2:50PM EDT until April 19 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Schoharie, Western Albany, Western Greene and Western Ulster Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The heavy wet snow may bring down some tree limbs and cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will overspread the area early this evening, then change to snow as precipitation rates increase. Snowfall rates may reach an inch per hour tonight into Tuesday morning. Accumulations will vary by elevation, with lower elevations such as the Schoharie Valley getting closer to 5 inches, while higher elevations above 2000 feet getting closer to 10 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Ulster
